text: Dame Judi Dench is battling failing eyesight which has left her unable to read scripts. But the actress has said she is driven “ spare ” by people asking when she will retire because she has no intention of leaving the stage. The 79 - year - old was diagnosed with macular degeneration, which can lead to blindness, several years ago. She stars opposite Dustin Hoffman, 77, in a BBC1 Christmas adaptation of Roald Dahl ’ s Esio Trot, the touching story of a faltering love affair between two lonely pensioners. Speaking at a screening of the film in central London, Dame Judi issued a plea for the capacities of older people not to be ignored. The Oscar - winner said : “ It drives me absolutely spare when people say'Are you going to retire?'or
